section.para: To avoid the unnecessary confusion that can occur if negative quantity on hand (QOH) balances are used for planning purposes, the system gives you the ability to quickly and easily reset negative QOH values to "0". To reset negative QOH balances to zero, either globally or locally, select the Reset QOH Balances option. The following screen will appear:

tip.para: Be sure to thaw any item site whose negative QOH balance you want to reset to "0". An item site must be unfrozen before its QOH balance can be reset.

section.para: When resetting QOH balances, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select to reset QOH balances for all sites.
Specify site where QOH balances are to be reset.
Select to reset QOH balances for all class codes.
Specify class code whose QOH you want to reset.
Enter a class code pattern to select a range of class codes. Refine your search using Regular Expressions.
Specify the date you want the transaction to be posted to the general ledger. The current day's date will display by default.

section.para: The following buttons are unique to this screen:

listitem.para: Resets QOH balances for sites and class codes specified above.

note.para: Additional steps will be necessary if any items within the specified class code(s) are stored in multiple locations.
